title: Ticket #1495: Condor on Windows unable to run jobs in 64-bit mode
description:
We currently provide the Windows Condor as a 32-bit application. If run on a 64-bit Windows environment, Condor will be executed via the Windows-32-on-Windows-64 (WOW64) subsystem.

One of the advantages of 64-bit applications over 32-bit applications on Windows is that they are able to use more than 4GB of RAM. However, it seems if we spawn a Condor job, the executable is always run in 32-bit mode and can therefore not benefit from the 64-bit OS and suffers from the 4GB memory limit.

Condor should be able to run a job in 64-bit mode - if supported by the running Windows. All information collected so far indicates that it is possible to fork off a 64-bit process from a 32-bit program.

Relevant read:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/509989/how-to-allow-32-bit-apps-on-64-bit-windows-to-execute-64-bit-apps-provided-in-win
